messages.message:
@dlluncor @paul @Aaron Tami

So for Microsoft got off a call with them. They are making the rounds internally. They have never had this type of pass through model on their containers. They are getting all the right stakeholders involved to get something moving. Basically what they see is a short term and long-term legal plan.

Something to get us going initially that may be a bit harder (like having some sort of amendment we would need to have our clients sign that choose Microsoft OCR) vs a longer term which would be some formal larger agreement in place.

They will get back to us in the next few days with next steps as they internally get everything collected and the right stakeholders involved.
good to know thanks @Matt — did we get the legal agreement in place so we can ship to SC?
Not yet, we will know more in the few days.
Thanks for the update. Was Steve on the call?
He was not, lawyers are not involved just yet they are getting all the relevant parties aligned for us.
Got it, makes sense. If there’s anything they can do with us directly and not with our customers, that would be ideal. Doing amendments with our customers is a big headache
Yeah, I made that clear and they were on the same page as they know how difficult it could be so we are shooting for the easiest thing for all parties
@Ted @Hari for MSFT OCR updates (for SC)
@Matt you’re going to end up with an honorary JD after all these contract calls
You can now call me Esquire Matt
Matthew X Carnali, Esquire the third

My SC 2c. We (which I guess means @paul or @Hari) would be helped by being really pro-active helping Vikram line up all their internal legal / IT approval etc.

MSFT OCR is a huge deal to them. Before I had even finished the sentence "you'll need to send back statistics to Microsoft" Vikram was already furiously war dialing all his contacts in Legal.
So any guidance / information we can get them as early as possible I think will be used eagerly by them

Being proactive would be great; we can’t do anything until we have a clue what sort of thing MSFT is going to ask for. They are notorious for having pretty thick license agreements and I assume this one isn’t going to be a two paragraph amendment. But it could look a lot of different ways.
Anything we can get ahead of would be amazing; I’ll take point in working with SC on this, but we can’t just tell them that Microsoft is going to ask for “something”
We already know what Microsoft is going to ask them to send back. So we can begin to message that and get them comfortable with page count data
That’s a separate issue from the legal work
that conversation has already started with SC and C1
we can’t deploy anything without an agreement in place
Totally just want to make sure that conversation has started
yes
